{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Creative Manager",
  "description": "Tailored by Maju is a bespoke tailoring fashion brand that deals with making luxury custom made dresses, Asoebi, bridal and ready to wears.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Skills and Requirements


	Keeping our daily operations running smoothly and efficiently.
	Managing schedules, appointments, and correspondence for the CEO and team.
	Organizing and maintaining important records and company documents.
	Acting as the main point of contact for clients, ensuring clear and professional communication.
	Handling client orders and making sure everything is processed on time, especially when the CEO is unavailable.
	Providing top-notch customer service by addressing client inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
	Coordinating logistics, including product movement and delivery schedules.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent English communication skills&mdash;both written and spoken&mdash;with the ability to articulate yourself clearly and confidently.
	Great customer service skills and the ability to build strong client relationships.
	Experience handling logistics and ensuring orders are processed seamlessly.
	A willingness to learn on the job, adapt to new challenges, and grow with the company.
	Gender Preference; Female.


Salary
Competitive

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;thetailoredbymajurecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Creative Manager Job at Tailored by Maju




        
    

        
        Tailored by Maju is a bespoke tailoring fashion brand that deals with making luxury custom made dresses, Asoebi, bridal and ready to wears.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Manager
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Skills and Requirements
     

            
    




	Keeping our daily operations running smoothly and efficiently.
	Managing schedules, appointments, and correspondence for the CEO and team.
	Organizing and maintaining important records and company documents.
	Acting as the main point of contact for clients, ensuring clear and professional communication.
	Handling client orders and making sure everything is processed on time, especially when the CEO is unavailable.
	Providing top-notch customer service by addressing client inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
	Coordinating logistics, including product movement and delivery schedules.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent English communication skills—both written and spoken—with the ability to articulate yourself clearly and confidently.
	Great customer service skills and the ability to build strong client relationships.
	Experience handling logistics and ensuring orders are processed seamlessly.
	A willingness to learn on the job, adapt to new challenges, and grow with the company.
	Gender Preference; Female.


Salary
Competitive

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: thetailoredbymajurecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Assistant",
  "description": "Oilserv Limited is a leading provider of integrated engineering, procurement, construction, installation &amp; commissioning (EPCIC) services and complementary solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the onshore, offshore and subsea market segments of the oil and gas sector. Oilserv Limited was incorporated in 1992 and commenced operations in 1995.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Warehouse Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp; Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	This position supports the efficient operation of the warehouse by handling the receipt, storage, and issuance of spare parts and consumables
	Ensures accurate record-keeping, updating of bin cards, proper labelling, and safe handling of materials while maintaining stock organization and cleanliness
	Assists with inventory counts, monitors stock levels, and issuance of materials to ensure timely availability of spares required for maintenance activities.


Job Details


	Assist in receiving, unloading, and checking incoming goods and materials.
	Accurately label, store, and organize inventory in designated bin locations in the warehouse&nbsp;
	Assist the warehouse officer in daily cycle count and resolve discrepancies
	Pick, pack, and prepare items for dispatch in line with delivery schedules.
	Perform SAP checks and resolve discrepancies between physical stock and book records
	Assist in creation of warehouse purchase requisitions in SAP
	Maintain stock records and update inventory management systems.
	Conduct routine stock checks and report discrepancies to Warehouse supervisor
	Ensure warehouse cleanliness, orderliness, and compliance with safety standards.
	Any&nbsp;other duties&nbsp;that&nbsp;may&nbsp;be&nbsp;assigned&nbsp;by&nbsp;management.


Requirements


	Minimum of Entry to 5 years of&nbsp;experience.
	CIPS &ndash; Completed level 4


Benefits


	HMO Coverage
	Pension Contributions
	Leave Allowance
	Etc.

Warehouse Assistant Job at Oilserv Limited




        
    

        
        Oilserv Limited is a leading provider of integrated engineering, procurement, construction, installation & commissioning (EPCIC) services and complementary solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the onshore, offshore and subsea market segments of the oil and gas sector. Oilserv Limited was incorporated in 1992 and commenced operations in 1995.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant

Job Location:  Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	This position supports the efficient operation of the warehouse by handling the receipt, storage, and issuance of spare parts and consumables
	Ensures accurate record-keeping, updating of bin cards, proper labelling, and safe handling of materials while maintaining stock organization and cleanliness
	Assists with inventory counts, monitors stock levels, and issuance of materials to ensure timely availability of spares required for maintenance activities.


Job Details


	Assist in receiving, unloading, and checking incoming goods and materials.
	Accurately label, store, and organize inventory in designated bin locations in the warehouse 
	Assist the warehouse officer in daily cycle count and resolve discrepancies
	Pick, pack, and prepare items for dispatch in line with delivery schedules.
	Perform SAP checks and resolve discrepancies between physical stock and book records
	Assist in creation of warehouse purchase requisitions in SAP
	Maintain stock records and update inventory management systems.
	Conduct routine stock checks and report discrepancies to Warehouse supervisor
	Ensure warehouse cleanliness, orderliness, and compliance with safety standards.
	Any other duties that may be assigned by management.


Requirements


	Minimum of Entry to 5 years of experience.
	CIPS – Completed level 4


Benefits


	HMO Coverage
	Pension Contributions
	Leave Allowance
	Etc.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
